attributes.additional_details: Gyms are crucial for improving both the mental and physical health; therefore, vital in protecting against COVID-19. Nicola Sturgeon claimed she wanted to prioritise the health of the country, however gyms have been consistently closed during restrictions. Opening gyms on April 28th along with indoor hospitality shows they are not being prioritised as they should. Surely it's more important that people can exercise rather than go out to eat? And surely more important than getting a haircut?
attributes.background: Open gyms on April 5th along with hairdressers & prioritise Scotland's health.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee.

If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
